references.reason: This paper introduced the concept of open-set deep networks, a fundamental concept for open-set domain generalization (OSDG).

references.paper_title: Learning to generalize: Meta-learning for domain generalization
references.reason: This work pioneered the use of meta-learning for domain generalization, a key technique used in many OSDG methods.
This paper introduced MixStyle, a data augmentation technique effective for improving domain generalization, directly relevant to OSDG.

references.paper_title: Efficienttrain: Exploring generalized curriculum learning for training visual backbones
references.reason: This work explores curriculum learning for visual backbones, which is relevant to the adaptive domain scheduling proposed in this paper.

references.paper_title: Generalizable decision boundaries: Dualistic meta-learning for open set domain generalization
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant as it directly addresses open-set domain generalization using dualistic meta-learning, a very similar approach to the one presented in this paper.
